sn12.60:1.1: This Nidānasutta opens in a way practically identical to the Mahānidānasutta (DN 15). However, after the introduction it merely recapitulates the teachings from the previous discourses, unlike the Mahānidānasutta which introduces a dazzling range of unique perspectives. It is hardly possible that Ānanda would make the same mistake twice, so it seems likely that the present discourse is an artificial composite.
